episodeTitle: Luffy's Treatment Begins - Ivan-san's Miraculous Power!!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ治療開始 イワさん奇跡の能力！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi Chiryō Kaishi - Iwa-san Kiseki no Chikara!!
description: Emporio Ivankov displays his extraordinary abilities, including his Death Wink and gender transformation powers. Despite the risks, Ivankov begins treating Luffy's deadly poisoning using his Healing Hormones, a process that will take 10 years off Luffy's lifespan and cause him extreme pain for over two days.

events.title: Death Wink Demonstrated
events.description: Emporio Ivankov demonstrates his incredible power by stopping a vengeful pirate's cannon shot using only a wink. The powerful wink creates a shockwave that repels the cannonball and sends it flying back.
events.significance: First full demonstration of Ivankov's signature Death Wink technique, showcasing the power of the Horu Horu no Mi Devil Fruit user.

quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov uses his signature technique to deflect a cannon

events.title: Gender Transformation Ability Revealed
events.description: Ivankov demonstrates his hormone-based gender transformation ability by injecting a vengeful pirate with hormones, instantly transforming him into a woman. This showcases another application of the Horu Horu no Mi's powers.
events.significance: Reveals one of the most unique abilities of the Horu Horu no Mi Devil Fruit - the power to change a person's biological sex through hormone manipulation.

events.title: Bon Clay's Plea for Luffy
events.description: Bon Clay desperately pleads with Ivankov to save Luffy's life. Ivankov reveals that he saved Bon Clay because Luffy begged him to, showing the depth of Luffy's compassion even while critically injured.
events.significance: Demonstrates the growing bond between Luffy and Bon Clay, and establishes Ivankov's respect for Luffy's character.

quotes.text: Please save Luffy! I'll do anything!
quotes.speaker: Bon Clay
quotes.context: Bon Clay pleading with Ivankov to heal Luffy

events.title: Luffy and Ace Childhood Flashback
events.description: A flashback shows young Luffy and Ace together by the ocean, smiling and enjoying their brotherhood. This memory surfaces as Luffy fights for his life, emphasizing his motivation to survive and save Ace.
events.significance: First glimpse of Luffy and Ace's childhood bond during the Impel Down arc, reinforcing Luffy's determination to rescue his brother.

events.title: Healing Hormones Debut
events.description: Emporio Ivankov begins treating Luffy with his Healing Hormones technique. The hormones stimulate Luffy's immune system to fight Magellan's deadly poison, but the treatment comes at a severe cost: it will take 10 years off Luffy's lifespan, cause him excruciating pain, and require over two days to complete - with Ace's execution only 16 hours away.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most significant medical abilities in One Piece. The lifespan sacrifice becomes a recurring topic in fan discussions about Luffy's longevity. This technique saves Luffy's life but at a permanent cost.

quotes.text: This treatment will take 10 years off your life! Only those with an extraordinary will to live can survive it!
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov warning about the cost of the Healing Hormones

events.title: Buggy and Galdino's Wolf Encounter
events.description: While fleeing through Level 5's frozen hell on wax stilts, Buggy and Galdino encounter a pack of fierce wolves. This comedic moment provides relief from the intensity of Luffy's treatment.
events.significance: Continues the subplot of Buggy and Mr. 3's escape attempt, adding levity to an otherwise heavy episode.

events.title: Bellett's Debut
events.description: Bellett, a member of the Newkama Land community, makes their first appearance in the series.
events.significance: Minor character introduction in the Newkama Land community.

quotes.text: This treatment will take 10 years off your life! Only those with an extraordinary will to live can survive it!
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov explaining the cost of the Healing Hormones to save Luffy

quotes.text: Please save Luffy! I'll do anything!
quotes.speaker: Bon Clay
quotes.context: Bon Clay desperately pleading with Ivankov

themes.description: Luffy must sacrifice 10 years of his lifespan to survive Magellan's poison and continue his quest to save Ace. This theme explores the cost of survival and determination.
themes.symbolism: The Healing Hormones represent the price heroes must pay - Luffy's willingness to give up years of his life shows his absolute determination to save his brother.

themes.description: Bon Clay's desperate plea to save Luffy demonstrates the deep bonds formed through shared hardship. Ivankov's decision to help is influenced by Luffy's own compassion in saving Bon Clay.
themes.symbolism: The cycle of救助 (救助) - Luffy saved Bon Clay, Bon Clay pleads for Luffy, and Ivankov responds to this chain of compassion.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the ticking clock: Luffy's treatment takes over 2 days, but Ace's execution is in 16 hours. This creates dramatic tension about whether Luffy can possibly reach Ace in time.
themes.symbolism: The countdown represents the impossible odds Luffy faces, yet his determination never wavers.

themes.description: Newkama Land and Ivankov's gender transformation abilities present a unique celebration of gender expression and acceptance in the One Piece world.
themes.symbolism: Ivankov's powers represent freedom of identity and self-expression.
culturalReferences: Newkama is a play on 'new half' (ニューハーフ), a Japanese term for transgender individuals

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov demonstrates his incredible Devil Fruit abilities and medical expertise. His decision to help Luffy despite the time constraints shows his respect for Luffy's character and willpower.
keyActions: Begins treating Luffy with Healing Hormones
Explains the severe cost of the treatment
quotes: This treatment will take 10 years off your life! Only those with an extraordinary will to live can survive it!

characterSpotlights.development: Bon Clay's emotional plea shows how much his friendship with Luffy means to him. His desperation and willingness to do anything to save Luffy demonstrates his character growth from antagonist to devoted ally.
keyActions: Pleads desperately with Ivankov to save Luffy
Expresses willingness to do anything to help
quotes: Please save Luffy! I'll do anything!

characterSpotlights.development: Though unconscious and suffering, Luffy's extraordinary willpower is the only reason he can survive the Healing Hormones treatment. His memories of Ace drive his will to live.
keyActions: Flashback shows his bond with Ace

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, young Ace is shown wearing his signature orange hat, beaded necklace, and shirtless, which contradicts the manga where he acquired these items later in his journey.
The anime extends certain scenes with Buggy and Galdino for comedic effect and pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode covers manga chapters 537 (pages 10-19) and 538 (pages 2-7).
The episode includes a reference to 'Gangsta's Paradise' in the English subtitled version during Ivankov's treatment dialogue.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Luffy and Franky.
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 11.9%, ranking #3 in its timeslot.
The opening theme 'Kaze wo Sagashite' was sung by Mari Yaguchi and Straw Hat, and was used from episodes 426-458.

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is the first time Ivankov's Healing Hormones technique is shown being used in the series.

sources.title: Horu Horu no Mi - One Piece Wiki
